page.title: 04TROON Cornwall - Employment
page.content: This part of Cornwall is very largely a farming community, the majority of this being grazing land for livestock. Consequently employment in the area is very scarce. The largest employer in the area is the Pendarves Tin Mine, employing 60 people. Owned by a subsidiary of Rio Tinto Zinc it is the first new mine shaft to be sunk in Cornwall this century. In TROON village itself there are a number of shops, all largely run as family concerns, a primary school, a taxi firm and Grenville's Bus Garage. Of the remaining population few have work as the unemployment in Cornwall is higher than the national average. Those who do work have to travel to Camborne, Redruth and beyond to find jobs.
